block.p: He uses architectural models (which he sometimes floods with water) to take arresting photographs, and she uses photography and video art to tackle questions of gender and racial identity. Both halves of the high-art power couple James Casebere and Lorna Simpson work in the same four-story studio, designed by the starchitect David Adjaye. Their work might be highbrow, but they share a down-to-earth aversion to fashion. Simpson favors vintage clothes ''with a flair,'' she says, while Casebere thinks of himself as ''a real plain Midwestern dresser.'' ''He used to wear plaid,'' Simpson teases, ''but not good plaid.''
